titleStmt.title: The practice of the Exchequer court, with its severall offices and officers being a short narration of the power and duty of each single person in his severall place. Written at the request of the Lord Buckhurst, sometime Lord Treasurer of England. By Sr. T.F. Whereunto are added the rules and orders of proceedings by English bill.
titleStmt.author: Osborne, Peter, 1521-1592.

titleStmt.title: The practice of the Exchequer court, with its severall offices and officers being a short narration of the power and duty of each single person in his severall place. Written at the request of the Lord Buckhurst, sometime Lord Treasurer of England. By Sr. T.F. Whereunto are added the rules and orders of proceedings by English bill.
titleStmt.author: Osborne, Peter, 1521-1592.
Fanshawe, Thomas Fanshawe, Viscount, 1596-1665, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.R. for Tim Twyford and W. Place, and are to be sold at their shops within the Inner Temple gate, and at Grays Inne gate in Holborne,

notesStmt.note: Identified on UMI microfilm (Early English books) as Wing F420.
In Bodleian Library copy Table (A-M) appears at the beginning and (N-Z) is bound at end; in British Library copy the entire Table appears at end.
Reproductions of the originals in Bodleian Library (Early English books), and the British Library (Thomason Tracts).
